intro: Fagelia alba, commonly known as the white fagelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Fagelia alba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
